alert.note: Alert for Volusia (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued September 30 at 11:50AM EDT until further notice by NWS Melbourne
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 3 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall has occurred. * WHERE...A portion of east central Florida, including the following county, Volusia. * WHEN...Until 300 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1147 AM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Between 4 and 7 inches of rain have already fallen this morning. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Daytona Beach, Port Orange, Ormond Beach, DeLand, New Smyrna Beach, South Daytona, Holly Hill, Lake Helen, DeLeon Springs, Ormond-By-the-Sea, Daytona Beach Shores, Daytona International Speedway, Daytona Beach Airport, DeLand Airport, Ponce Inlet, Spruce Creek, DeLand Highlands, Samsula-Spruce Creek, North DeLand and Ormond Beach Airport. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
